ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Semiconductor physics, from first principles to lab characterisation practices

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: very interesting material and excellent labs

weaknesses: sparse, non-detailed and very delayed feedback on assignments coupled with sub-optimal functioning of the office hour-sceduling system

The class covers a wide range of content which is mathematically challenging, and also some lab experiments are very repetitive / tedious. But since the contents and organization are as expected for a first course on semiconductors, I'm not sure how this can be significantly improved.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you need it for your major or if you are interested in the material.
Be prepared to spend a lot of time on this course, such as doing the labs.
